Refractive index n = 2 indicates light travels at twice the speed in the semi-cylindrical body compared to air.
Calculate the area of the cylindrical surface that allows light to exit through the semi-cylindrical body.
Identify given parameters: Radius R, Length L, Refractive index n = 2.
Semi-cylinder has a circular base with radius R; light travels from vertical surface to curved surface, exiting through the semi-cylinder.
Area of a semi-cylinder is given by A = πR².
Area of the cylindrical surface is given by A = 2πRL.
Area of the cylindrical surface that allows light to exit is the difference between the area of the semi-cylinder and the area of the cylindrical surface.
Area of the semi-cylinder A = πR²; Area of the cylindrical surface A = 2πRL; Area of cylindrical surface that allows light to exit A_exit = πR² - 2πRL.
Substitute given values: R = 1, L = 2, n = 2.
Re-evaluate calculation since area cannot be negative: Area of cylindrical surface that allows light to exit is 2πRL - πR².
Calculate final answer: Area S of part of cylindrical surface is 3π.
The area S of the part of the cylindrical surface is 3π.
